head.title: Welcome to Ottawa Township High School

link.script: /* Initialize and render the MenuBar when its elements are ready to be scripted. */ YAHOO.util.Event.onContentReady("headerlinksbar", function () { /* Instantiate a MenuBar: The first argument passed to the constructor is the id of the element in the page representing the MenuBar; the second is an object literal of configuration properties. */ var oMenuBar = new YAHOO.widget.MenuBar("headerlinksbar", { autosubmenudisplay: true, hidedelay:100, lazyload: true, minscrollheight: 200}); /* Call the "render" method with no arguments since the markup for this MenuBar instance is already exists in the page. */ oMenuBar.render(); });

meta.title: Untitled Document
meta.p: The mission of Ottawa Township High School, in a cooperative effort with students, parents and community, is to educate students in a safe, positive, challenging environment which promotes responsible citizenship and active lifelong learning.Ottawa Township High School has the responsibility to: Help students grow intellectually, personally, physically, and socially in proportion to their abilities to the extent that they will assume an increasing obligation for their own education, personal well-being, and social awareness. Reaffirm our commitment to a government of the people and to encourage the obligations of good citizenship and respect for law and order. Guide students in developing skills, attitudes, and habits needed by effective leaders and intelligent followers. Demonstrate that many fields of knowledge are inter-related and that each area can contribute significantly to studentÃ¢ÂÂs intellectual growth.

div.p: URGENT: Pick Up of Student Property Dear OTHS Students, Parents, and Guardians, The latest provisions put in place by Governor Pritzker allow educational institutions to establish procedures for pick up of student belongings and return of school property in the possession of students. OTH Full Story...

Commencement Ceremony and Honors Program Information To the OTHS Community: The OTHS administration, faculty, and staff understand the importance of special events to both our students and their families. As we near the end of the school year, it is our goal to proudly recognize and share in the accomplis Full Story...

Remote Planning Day #3 Monday, April 27, will be used as Remote Planning Day #3. Teachers will use this day to continue their planning for Remote Learning. Students will return to Remote Learning on Tuesday, April 28. Full Story...

Remote Learning Calendar With confirmation of the mandated school closure through Thursday, April 30, 2020, please note the calendar information below: March 17-30, 2020 ISBE Act of God Days Ã¢ÂÂ Mandated School Closure March 31, 2020 Remote Learning Planning Day 1 April 1 Full Story...

URGENT UPDATE: Remote Learning Guidelines, Expectations and Directions OTHS Remote Learning Program Ã¢ÂÂ Student Expectations, Directions and Information General Information: Ottawa Township High School is providing supplementary educational activities during the mandatory school closures. These activities may come in the Full Story...

URGENT: OTHS Remote Learning Plan Dear OTHS Learning Community Members, Below and attached to this document you will find the DistrictÃ¢ÂÂs Remote Learning Plan. This plan will be followed by school officials until the mandated school closure concludes. This plan will be updated through Full Story...

Wi-Fi Assistance Information Please see message below from the Regional Office of Education. Listed below are four companies with details and contact information regarding free and/or reduced Wi-Fi to our students.ÃÂ Beginning March 16th, Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband a Full Story...

div.p: Bullying Policy Ottawa Township High School will not tolerate harassing, intimidating conduct, or bullying whether verbal, physical, or visual, that affects the tangible benefits of education, that unreasonably interferes with a studentÃ¢ÂÂs educational performance, or th Full Story...
